channel.title: Auhome | Mail Online
channel.description: Daily Mail Australia - all the latest Australian news, sport, showbiz, science and health stories from the Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers

item.title: Leichhardt cottage with rotten floors, damp walls and a grotty kitchen sells for $900k
item.description: A tiny, squalid Leichhardt home in Sydney’s inner west (pictured) has sold for $900,000 at auction, reminding prospective home-owners the boom is far from over.

item.title: Takashi Kobayashi and Hiroshi Nakamura build treehouse around 300 year old tree
item.description: Takashi Kobayashi collaborated with Hiroshi Nakamura to create Kusukusu (pictured), a sprawling structure built around a towering camphor tree in Atami, southern Japan.

item.title: The Girl Beneath the Headscarf's Wiwid Howat on mixing trendy fashion and conservative style
item.description: She turned down five potential husbands, married in the name of love and followed her heart to focus on fashion - meet Sydney's Wiwid Howat.

item.title: Sydney socialite Kirsty Dayment 'arrested and charged with selling drugs'
item.description: Kirsty Dayment, 33, who runs her own fashion store and is well-known in the Sydney social scene, was charged by police and the NSW Crime Commission last week.

item.title: Eddie McGuire denies racism after calling John Eren a ‘Turkish-born Mussie’
item.description: Media personality and powerful AFL figure Eddie McGuire (pictured) has denied he made a racist remark when calling Victorian sports minister John Eren a ‘soccer loving Turkish-born Mussie’.

item.title: Aurora shooting victim's families WALKED OUT on hearing James Holmes sentence
item.description: James Holmes will spend the rest of his life in prison after at least one juror balked at the possibility of sentencing him to death for the massacre.

item.title: Weekend Today host Deborah Knight announces third pregnancy on live TV
item.description: Weekend Today co-host Deborah Knight announced she's pregnant with her third child, a baby girl...just weeks after the show's newsreader, Wendy Kingston, gave viewers the same news.

item.title: Giant Florida alligator drags swimmer underwater and rips off her arm at the elbow - stopping only when nearby canoeist beats it with a paddle
item.description: The unnamed victim was enjoying the water in the Wekiva River, near Wekiva Springs, Florida, on Saturday afternoon when she was dragged under the water by the alligator.

item.title: Trump campaign in turmoil: War of words as tycoon 'fires’ key adviser who claims to have quit first, and Jeb Bush calls for apology over 'sexist' attack on Megyn Kelly
item.description: Trump's campaign said in a statement that the GOP presidential candidate fired his longtime friend, Roger Stone, last night. Not true, say allies of Stone - he quit.

item.title: Rolf Harris 'filmed behind bars as part of documentary by daughter Bindi'
item.description: The convicted paedophile will appear in a film from HMP Stafford, where he is serving a five year sentence for sexually assaulting young girls, it was reported today.

item.title: Elton John in Monaco ambulance after hurting leg during tennis match says GIRL ABOUT TOWN
item.description: Elton John was taken to hospital in Monaco after his leg swelled up during a game of tennis at his home in the south of France, with doctors discovering an abscess on his thigh.

item.title: Six Flags in New Orleans stands empty 10 years after Hurricane Katrina
item.description: Photographer Seph Lawless documented the decay of the Six Flags amusement park outside New Orleans following ten years of abandonment and failed redevelopment after Hurricane Katrina.

item.title: Phil and Gary Neville's sister Tracey roars on England netball team after minute's silence
item.description: The England coach was courtside to see her squad edge world No.4 Jamaica in their second World Cup pool match in Sydney the day after her dad suffered a fatal heart attack en route to Australia.

item.title: 'Da Vinci' robot allows patients to leave hospital two days after major surgery
item.description: The Da Vinci robot, used by the Newcastle Hospital Trust, has allowed patients to leave hospital within two days of surgery, suffering only minimal post-operative pain.

item.title: Australian captain Michael Clarke says he's going to retire from cricket
item.description: Australia captain Michael Clarke has broken down after announcing he will retire from international cricket after the final Ashes Test at The Oval.
item.media:description: NOTTINGHAM, ENGLAND - AUGUST 07: Michael Clarke of Australia looks dejected after being dismissed by Mark Wood of England during day two of the 4th Investec Ashes Test match between England and Australia at Trent Bridge on August 7, 2015 in Nottingham, United Kingdom. (Photo by Ryan Pierse/Getty Images)

item.title: Gucci sisters Alessandra and Allegra's duplex listed for $45million
item.description: Alessandra and Allegra Gucci inherited the 9,500-square-foot penthouse after Maurizio Gucci was shot in 1995. The duplex, on the 50th and 51st floors, is currently rented out for $60,000 a month.

item.title: Sydney man who attacked his brother-in-law with an axe is in critical condition
item.description: A Sydney man who violently attacked his brother-in-law with an axe has been left in critical condition after a third man intervened, beating him unconscious with a baseball bat.

item.title: Christopher Pyne flew family to Sydney and Tony Burke holidayed in Uluru on taxpayer money
item.description: After ducking questions about the appropriateness of fellow MP's travel expenses earlier today, reports have emerged that Joe Hockey jetted his entire family to Perth on business class flights.

item.title: Kelly Rutherford won't fly Helena and Hermes back to Daniel Giersch in Monaco
item.description: The actress was due to send Helena, six, and Hermes, eight, back to the French principality on Thursday, to be with her ex husband Daniel Giersch.

item.title: Jennifer Garner and Ben Affleck wear wedding bands during Atlanta family outing
item.description: It has been two months since they revealed plans to divorce, yet Jennifer Garner and Ben Affleck are said to continue sporting their wedding rings for the well-being of their three children.
item.media:description: 140991, Ben Affleck and Jennifer Garner reunite as they step out in Atlanta with children Seraphina and Samuel - both wearing their wedding rings! Affleck and Garner recently announced they would be divorcing after 10 years of marriage, shortly after allegations surfaced that Affleck was having an affair with the family's 28 year-old nanny, Christine Ouzounian. Affleck was spotted arriving in Atlanta yesterday, where Garner has been filming 'Miracles from Heaven.' The family were seen entering a local mall. Atlanta, Georgia - Saturday August 8, 2015. Photograph: © RGK, PacificCoastNews. Los Angeles Office: +1 310.822.0419 sales@pacificcoastnews.com FEE MUST BE AGREED PRIOR TO USAGE

item.title: Burning Man won't have Bureau of Land Management officials and police in luxury
item.description: The US Bureau of Land Management rescinded its request for VIP housing for law enforcement and officials from Washington, DC, at the event. The event in Nevada's Black Rock Desert starts August 30.

item.title: Kentucky hospital appeals for help to transport a 768-lb pound man who has been stuck in one their rooms for a MONTH
item.description: James King, 45, who weighs 768 pounds, has been stuck in a room at Baptist Health in Paducah for almost one month. The hospital says it does not have the resources to keep on caring for him.

item.title: The Queen's £40k luxury loft for the royal racing pigeons on Sandringham estate
item.description: The Queen is having to splash out on a luxury new home for her royal pigeons after their loft on the Sandringham estate has started to subside and has rotting timbers and poor flooring.

item.title: Keep my dog or husband? It's a close-run thing says SARAH OLIVER
item.description: Columnist Sarah Oliver on the bizarre existence of pet-nups - and whether it is something work looking into, freeloading Beatrice, the 'legacy' of London 2012, and charity's Queen of Compassion.

item.title: 1 of Cecil the lion's cubs killed by a rival after dentist Walter Palmer shot him
item.description: The much-loved lion was killed by American dentist Walter Palmer in Zimbabwe last month - sparking outrage around the world.

item.title: Cilla Black's sons break silence as they follow mother's body to the UK from Spain
item.description: Speaking as they left the property in Estepona where the 72-year-old suffered a stroke on her sun terrace, Robert Willis, 36, said the three were eager to return to Britain after a 'long week'.

item.title: Incredible pictures show South African Cape ground squirrels
item.description: These two squirrels were photographed in the grips of what looks like the sensual South American dance. They were pictured in their natural habitat in South Africa's Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park.

item.title: WAGs support their England Ashes heroes but can you guess who is whose partner?
item.description: Yesterday as the England cricket team destroyed Australia and regained the Ashes at Trent Bridge, their glamorous partners seized their moment in the limelight.

item.title: Prince Harry joins war on poachers at Crocodile River in Kruger Park
item.description: Prince Harry is at the front line of a bloody war against rhino poachers, joining heavily armed forces battling gangs of criminals wielding rifles and machetes.

item.title: Steven Spielberg is selling £120m, 282ft mega yacht because it is 'too small'
item.description: Forty years after Roy Scheider exclaimed, ‘We’re gonna need a bigger boat’ in Jaws – it seems the film’s director Steven Spielberg has taken the sentiment very firmly to heart.

item.title: Is Jane Kiiza the first British woman to die of £8k curve enhancement?
item.description: Jane Kiiza, from north London, died following an increasingly popular ‘curve enhancing’ cosmetic operation on her buttocks known as a Brazilian lift.

item.title: Dystrophic Epidermolysis Bullosa research boosted by record bike ride
item.description: Tom Davies, from Battersea, south west London, completed the 18,000-mile trek to boost a fund set up to research a cure for Recessive Dystrophic Epidermolysis Bullosa.

item.title: Richard Branson and how his mother Eve Branson brought him up
item.description: Eve Branson tells AMY OLIVER about raising her 'absolutely impossible' son and reveals the truth about being 'saved' by Kate Winslet from a raging inferno on Necker Island in 2011.

item.title: Eric Clapton's rift with daughter Ruth who tweeted that he dressed up as Kermit
item.description: The guitarist has become secretly estranged from his daughter Ruth in a bitter rift that threatens to tear the family apart, with sources revealing the cause of the row as her tweets.

item.title: Pravastatin could save pregnant women from potentially fatal high blood pressure
item.description: Experts, including researchers at Aston University in Birmingham, hope the discovery will lead to a new treatment for pre-eclampsia, which is linked to one in 20 stillbirths.

item.title: Police and MI5 race to foil IED attack on the Queen at World War II anniversary
item.description: The Mail on Sunday can reveal that police and MI5 are involved in a frantic race against time to thwart the assassination plot in London, which is being orchestrated from Syria by Islamic State commanders.

item.title: Google likely to pick Presidential candidates whose names come on top of search
item.description: Undecided voters were 12 per cent more likely to pick candidates whose name appeared at the top of a search, a U.S. study showed, meaning the site has likely already helped to sway elections.
item.media:description:
The Google search engine webpage being reflected in an eye.
The Google search engine webpage being reflected in an eye. (Photo by: Newscast/UIG via Getty Images)

item.title: Rolf Harris 'tried to blame child porn on his own grandson'
item.description: The confidant treated as an adopted son of Rolf Harris reveals how, as the police net closed around the depraved artist, a desperate Harris sought to pin the blame on those closest to him.

item.title: Ethan McKen feared dead after being swept to sea on Thomas Cook Bulgaria holiday
item.description: Ethan McKen (pictured) had not long arrived in Sunny Beach, near Burgas on Bulgaria's east coast, when he and a friend were pulled out to sea in the early hours of Saturday. He's not been seen since.

item.title: Apple to unveil its new iPhone and iPad on September 9
item.description: Sources in the know claim Apple is planning an event for the week of September 7, with September 9 being the most likely date for its annual autumn media event.

item.title: Delta Airlines pilots make emergency landing after hail storm cracked windshield
item.description: The Delta Airlines flight from Boston to Salt Lake City had to land in Denver on Friday evening after a storm wrecked the front of the plane - including its GPS navigation system.

item.title: Bali ash cloud causes more travel misery for holidaymakers
item.description: Travellers are facing another day of cancelled flights in and out of Bali as volcanic ash cloud continues to play havoc with holiday plans.

item.title: Predators have vertical slits for pupils, while prey have 'letterbox' shaped holes
item.description: Scientists at the University of California at Berkeley studied the eyes of 214 land species to deduce that predators have differently shaped eyes to prey.

item.title: 'If employees can text the boss ... then it may be appropriate': Senator Eric Abetz defends cruel text message sacking of nearly 100 Australian port workers before clarifying he didn't understand the context
item.description: Federal employment minister Eric Abetz has defended the actions of Hutchison Ports, who sacked 97 Australians from Brisbane and Sydney at midnight via text message on Thursday.

item.title: James Packer's house sold for a whopping $70 million in Sydney
item.description: The sale of James Packer's home in Sydney for $70 million put luxury trophy homes at the forefront of property discussions. We look a luxury properties around Australia (QLD estate pictured).

item.title: Baby jihadis: Tiny child pictured next to a gun in new wave of ISIS recruitment in Indonesia
item.description: A helpless baby has been propped next to a huge machine gun and grenade, alongside a sign imploring Indonesians to travel to Syria in support of the extremist Muslim group, ISIS.

item.title: ‘Because of our size we were considered irrelevant': One of Australia's first 'plus' sized models reveals what it was like modelling in an industry where thin was in
item.description: Sydney's Chelsea Bonner was one of Australia's first 'plus' models. In an industry where thin was in, she embraced her curves and landed a shoot with SHE magazine, changing the face of beauty

item.title: Dad and child Beata Wloclawski reunited after 35 years apart speak different languages
item.description: Lisa Tinti, right, was known as Beata Wloclawska when she last saw her father, Andrzej, left, in Poland as she set off for a new life in Britain, but they were finally re-united this week.

item.title: England's players get straight into the beers to celebrate Ashes win
item.description: After annihilating the Aussies on the first day of the third test, England wrapped up the series two days later, prompting wild celebrations from players and fans.

item.title: Eminem sparks outrage with disturbing rap that describes raping women on soundtrack for Straight Outta Compton
item.description: The 42-year-old father-of-three screams, 'I even make the b****es I rape c*m,' in a rap solo on Dr Dre's song Medicine Man. The line has been met with a storm of criticism.

item.title: Injuries suffered by aspiring Nottingham model Lasha Horton left scarred for life
item.description: Lasha Horton, from Nottingham, was lucky to be alive after broken glass sliced her face almost from ear-to-ear, only narrowly missing her eyes and an artery.

item.title: Horror crash leaves seven seriously injured after two cars drove into each other on a regional road
item.description: Seven people have been seriously injured after a head-on collision in Armadale New South Wales. The driver of one car, a 19-year-old male, had to be airlifted to hospital.

item.title: New Jersey mother of bisexual teens responds to anti-gay graffiti by painting it rainbow
item.description: Erin Kennedy DeLong of Villas, New Jersey, and her husband Joe, turned the door into a symbol of pride for their daughters after a vandal scrawled 'I'm gay' across it in black paint.

item.title: A new Australian study shows that pears can lower alcohol levels
item.description: An Australian scientific organisation has found a sure-fire way to pre-pear you for those nasty hangovers, in a study showing a natural cure to lowering alcohol levels in your body.

item.title: Argentine judge orders body of racing star Fangio exhumed
item.description: The body of the late Formula 1 star Juan Manuel Fangio has been exhumed by orders of an Argentina judge for testing to determi...

item.title: Plymouth mother Jessica Jones who repeatedly smothered her baby sons is jailed
item.description: Jessica Jones, 22, was jailed for six years after pleading guilty to two counts of child cruelty against her sons, who she suffocated 10 times, before calling 999 and saying they had suffered 'fits'.

item.title: Kate Jakes who had received three new livers by the age of 22 dies
item.description: Kate Jakes, who received three liver transplants in just five years, has tragically died while awaiting her fourth. A tireless campaigner for organ donation, Kate told her story on her blog.

item.title: Rugby league star Shaun Kenny-Dowall 'needs more time' to return to the field after facing court over allegations of domestic violence against ex-Olympian Nova Peris's daughter Jessica
item.description: Football star Shaun Kenny Dowall (pictured) has told his coach that he will be sitting out another round of NRL, following a traumatic month that saw him charged with 11 domestic violence counts.

item.title: Moment morbidly obese sisters walk unaided for the first time after weight loss
item.description: Yogita Rameshbhai Nandwana (in red), five, weighed 5st 5lbs and sister Anisha (wearing green), three , 7st 8lbs, but the sisters from India have both lost 13 pounds thanks to a restricted diet.
item.media:credit: IMAGE SUPPLIED BY COVER ASIA PRESS

item.title: Incredible aerial pictures of the worlds greatest cities and sights
item.description: The images were taken by a group of Russian photographers, who travel the world snapping its most wondrous sights from helicopters, planes, hot air balloons and radio-controlled devices.

item.title: Sunbathers watch as rubber dinghy full of migrants arrive in Greece
item.description: Stretched on their beach towels and enjoying the blazing sunshine, the tourists seem unfazed by the dark green dingy, crammed full with people as it slowly approached the shore of Kos, Greece

item.title: Over 100 former Saddam Hussein-era officers make up ISIS leadership
item.description: Once part of one of the most brutal dictator's army in the Middle East, over 100 former members of Saddam Hussein's military and intelligence officers are now part of ISIS in Iraq and Syria.

item.title: Missing Jon Anderson Edwards' mother thought she saw him at Chelsea match
item.description: Lesley Edwards has been searching for her son, Jon Anderson Edwards, since last September, when he was reported missing after he failed to turn up for his job as a chef in Lagos, Portugal.

item.title: Romantic floating restaurant opens in China's Zhejiang Province
item.description: For anyone in search of a unique dining experience, look no further. The romantic restaurant is fashioned out of a wooden floating dock, and looks to only accommodate parties of two.

item.title: Glories of secret Britain: 20 enchanting gardens you MUST visit this season
item.description: In a search for Britain's unsung sightseeing gems, we've chosen 20 glorious gardens for you to enjoy, from the intimate to the grand. We've avoided the most famous so you'll escape the hordes.

item.title: Billionaire Dougherty Novella family 'shocked' at son who 'killed partner in sex game'
item.description: The billionaire Dougherty Novella family, one of Guatemala's richest clans, told Mail Online they are 'shocked' that relative Diego Dougherty, 41, has been accused of killing girlfriend Gabriela Kabrins.

item.title: The world's strangest tourist attractions revealed
item.description: Depending on where you are in the world, popular tourist spots can range from wonderfully wacky, such as Seattle's chewing gum-covered wall to downright chilling, like the Kutna Hora Bone Church.

item.title: Japanese Nagasaki bomb survivor reveals scars 70 years later
item.description: Pensioner Sumitery Taniguchi, now 86, was just 16 at the time of the second atomic attack on Japan, over Nagasaki. He spent 21 months lying on his stomach as his horrifying injuries healed.

item.title: Cosplay competitions across Sydney show fans in intricate costumes
item.description: SMASH! Annual Manga and Anime show has returned to Sydney, Australia. While another cosplay event will be held for League of Legends at Sydney's Luna Park.

item.title: Croatian island of Losinj is to become a star Adriatic attraction
item.description: Hotel chain Jadranka is spending a fortune in Croatia after building and re-developing a number of hotels and luxury villas - and have plans for a golf course and international airport.

item.title: Australia 27-19 New Zealand: Wallabies seal Rugby Championship with spirited victory against the All Blacks
item.description: Scrumhalf Nic White came off the bench to score 10 points in the last 11 minutes and give Australia victory over New Zealand and a first Rugby Championship title on Saturday.

item.title: German Sven Hagemeier celebrates his birthday for 46 HOURS flying across time zones
item.description: Sven Hagemeier, from Germany, has just set a record for the longest birthday celebration ever - strategically flying between time zones to extend the party for almost two days.

item.title: ISIS show off their latest batch of child soldier recruits in Syria
item.description: Taking aim with his heavy machine gun in his hands, the young boy's childhood appears to have finished now that he is one of ISIS newest recruits in the Syrian province of Damascus.

item.title: 'Legroom adjustable' plane seat adjusts to height of each traveller
item.description: In an era where it seems like every airline is trying to cram as many people in to get the best profits, legroom space comes at a premium - but a new 'legroom adjustable' seat is looking to change that.

item.title: Netflix set to overtake Foxtel as Australians embrace video-on-demand streaming
item.description: Netflix's surge in popularity within a mere five months, has seen it be one of the fastest adoptions of new technology in Australia's history with numbers in subscribers expecting to double by 2018.

item.title: Women make better magicians than men, claims president of the Magic Circle
item.description: Scott Penrose says that women are better suited to some tricks, and TV magician Katherine Mills, pictured, joked she may even hire a male assistant and 'dress him in Spandex'.

item.title: Perth boy Hamish Bolto whose throat was ripped open by barbed wire
item.description: A boy, 10, from Katanning, south-east of Perth, had his throat slit by a barbed wire fence in a motorbike accident. Hamish Bolto (pictured) has returned home after 101 days in hospital.

item.title: Respect and unity: Fans come together at Adam Goodes' first game since booing scandal to support the AFL legend in his fight against racism in the sport
item.description: Adam Goodes returned to the AFL field on Saturday to a warm reception of cheers, with fans out in force to show their support for the legend who almost retired due to consistent 'abuse' whilst playing.

item.title: George Cole hadn't spoken to daughter Harriet Angell for 45 YEARS before his death
item.description: Cole's eldest daughter Harriet Angell admitted this week that she hadn't spoken to the actor since the 1960s. Their relationship collapsed after he wed second wife Penny Morrell in 1967.

item.title: Levi Casboult honors promise to young fan by striking a double cobra pose
item.description: A Carlton player has flexed his biceps on the field, showcasing his muscular physique in a 'double cobra' pose, to make good on a promise he made to a young Carton fan last week.

item.title: Photographers flock to Instagram to share shots of weather rolling into Perth
item.description: A captivating, but ominous looking cloud has cast a colossal shadow over Perth this weekend, bringing with it the promise of wild weather.

item.title: Princess Mary of Denmark graces the runway at Copenhagen fashion week
item.description: Crown Princess Mary presents an award at Copenhagen fashion week on Friday

item.title: Typhoon Soudelor hits Taiwan, killing six, as it approaches mainland China
item.description: The eye of the storm passed over the island nation at around midday, injuring 101 and cancelling all domestic flights. The storm is approaching Zhejiang in China (pictured).

item.title: Proof you DO look different in every changing room mirror, AMANDA PLATELL writes
item.description: Why is it that some changing room mirrors seem to take a dress size off you and others add two? Femail's AMANDA PLATELL decided to find out.

item.title: Telling a person they're fat makes them even fatter
item.description: Psychologists found that believing you are overweight is counter productive – highlighting a problem for doctors trying to combat the obesity epidemic.

item.title: Pavarotti couldn’t get enough of it, Joan Collins honeymooned there… but you don't need to be a millionaire celebrity to holiday at the private island of Pangkor Laut
item.description: Pangkor Laut has long been a favourite holiday haunt of celebrities. And it has become more accessible to Brits thanks to British Airways' new daily flights to Malaysia.

item.title: 'All I could do was scream': Swedish tourist describes the moment she was tackled and wrestled to the ground by a man - as police warn his attacks will only get worse
item.description: A Swedish tourist was assaulted on a Melbourne street by a man whose sex crimes are escalating, police say.The 20-year-old woman was walking along a street in Richmond in the early hours of Friday.

item.title: Caught! Fisherman manages to reel in a drone flying high above San Diego pier
item.description: A man flying his camera drone over a pier at a San Diego beach recorded the moment a skilled fisherman cast his line and hooked the device.

item.title: Justin Staton charged with murder after killed grandparents in Arkansas
item.description: Justin Staton, 14, and Hunter Drexler, 17, were charged as adults with two counts of capital murder Friday in the July 22 deaths of Robert and Patricia Cogdell at their home in Conway, Arkansas.

item.title: Search underway for a man swept off rocks on Flinders Island
item.description: A man has been washed off rocks on the northern tip of Flinders Island, off Tasmania, where an air and sea search is now under way.

item.title: Speech clinics help transgender patients find their voices
item.description: The University of Connecticut's Speech and Hearing Clinic is one of a growing number of clinics with programs.

item.title: Married sex worker tackles Reddit's Ask Me Anything questions
item.description: A woman has welcomed questions from complete strangers on what it’s really like to be an Australian sex worker. The 22 year-old posted an ‘Ask Me Anything’ on Reddit.

item.title: Man spends 20 years saving up to buy ring for childhood sweetheart
item.description: On Saturday, Liang Liang used 12,000 yuan in coins to buy a proposal ring in Fuyang city, northwestern Anhui province, fulfilling his promise to one day marry his childhood sweetheart.

item.title: Apple spends $700k-a-year on security for CEO Tim Cook
item.description: Apple said the huge sum was for 'home and personal security' for Cook, but the huge sum is still less than half of the $1.6million that Amazon reportedly spends per year protecting Jeff Bezos.
item.media:description:
Timothy Cook, CEO of Apple, delivers opening remarks while testifying before the Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee's Investigations Subcommittee about the company's offshore profit shifting and tax avoidance in the Dirksen Senate Office Building on Capitol Hill in Washington, DC.
A Congressional report released yesterday said that Apple, America's most profitable technology company, used a complex system of international subsidiaries and tax avoidance efforts to shift at least $74 billion out of the reach of the Internal Revenue Service between 2009 and 2012. (Photo by Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images) *** BESTPIX *** WASHINGTON, DC - MAY 21:

item.title: Couple's 1st dance begins to Justin Timberlake before busting out 6-minute routine
item.description: Hollie and Dave Smith shunned the traditional slow, romantic first dance in favour of an all-singing, all-dancing routine, which the British couple choreographed for their special day.

item.title: Cindy Crawford's husband Rande Gerber gives a glimpse inside family's fridge
item.description: Cindy Crawford and Rande Gerber have 14 mouths to feed as they host guests during their lakeside vacation in Canada this week.

item.title: Two Georgia women arrested 'for keeping special needs siblings in cages
item.description: Stephanie Stone (pictured), 34, and Wanda Redfern, 49, of Georgia, have been charged with cruelty to children and false imprisonment after officers found Stone's 11-year-old son caged.

item.title: Couple of 68 years reunited while both are patients in Piedmont Fayette Hospital
item.description: A hospital worker's actions brought a 96-year-old man to tears after she helped to reunite him with his beloved wife of 68 years. The couple was put in separate rooms at Piedmont Fayette Hospital.

item.title: Beverly Hills mansion with bullet-proof safe room on sale for $29million
item.description: This European-style mansion in Beverly Hills, California, could be yours - if you are willing to fork out a whopping $29million. It is being sold by the estate of the late cardiologist Leonardo Berezovsky.

item.title: Teen couple Dylan and Lexie survive lightning strike by holding hands
item.description: A doctor told Dylan and Lexie of Claremont, California that holding hands helped diffuse the electrical current that hit them.

item.title: Pinata cake with sponge outside and sweets INSIDE is new baking craze
item.description: As the Great British Bake Off kicks off, Cakeology author Juliet Sear explains how to make her brightly coloured 'surprise' cake, made from hollowed out sponge hiding a selection of sweets.

item.title: Will we soon spot Little Green PLANTS in space? Light from our closest star Alpha Centauri could reveal signs of alien life on its planets
item.description: Astronomers have found that photosynthetic pigments in plants, algae and bacteria reflect light in distinctive ways, which may make it possible to spot life on planets orbiting distant stars.

item.title: Chongqing guest house listed for demolition remains open
item.description: Hotel is situated in the South Bank district of Chongqing, south west China. Negotiation for the demolition compensation haven't been finalised yet to owners have decided to keep hotel open.
